Description: Burlington Resources Inc. agreed to pay the United States $8.5 million to resolve claims under the False Claims Act and administrative claims that the corporation underpaid royalties due for oil produced on federal and Indian leases between 1988 and 1998.

Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Description: Conoco agreed to pay $26 million to resolve claims under the False Claims Act and administrative claims that the company underpaid royalties due for oil produced on federal and Indian leases since 1988.
To resolve a Clean Air Act case, Conoco agreed to spend up to $110 million to reduce emissions, pay a $1.5 million civil penalty and spend $5 million on supplementary environmental projects.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Description: ConocoPhillips Alaska, Inc, has signed a Consent Agreement and Final Order with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency stemming from a December, 2007 spill near their Kuparuk Unit petroleum facility on Alaska's North Slope. As part of the agreement, the company paid a $45,000 penalty.

Agency: Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration

Company: The Louisiana Land and Exploration Company
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Description: Burlington Resources Inc. agreed to pay the United States $97.5 million to resolve claims that it underpaid royalties owed on natural gas produced from federal and Indian leases.

Private Litigation Case Title: United Steel Paper & Forestry Rubber Manufacturing Energy Allied Industrial & Service Workers International Union AFL-CIO CLC et al v. ConocoPhillips Company

Description: Five oil producers -- Conoco, Unocal, Amerada Hess, Energen and Shell  -- agreed to pay a total of $21.8 million in settlement of claims they had underpaid severance taxes owed to the state for oil production. The announcement did not specify how much each company would pay. Here we assume the amount was divided evenly among them.

Conoco Inc. agreed to pay $1.5 million to Louisiana, Montana, Oklahoma and the federal government to resolve Clean Air Act violations. This was part of a larger $116 million settlement announced by the Justice Department; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-conoco-inc-2
